parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Rough, rugged, uneven. Perhaps strengthened from the base of rhegnumi; uneven, rocky.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; to fling (see in ekteino), which indicates an extended projection); by qualification, to deposit; by extension, to disperse.
Four. Or neuter tessara a plural number; four.
An anchor. From the same as agkale; an 'anchor'.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The stern of a ship. Feminine of prumnus; the stern of a ship.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pray, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to wish; by implication, to pray to God.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
